src: kɯm ɲɤ-stʰoʁ ri, kɯm pjɤ-k-ɤ-ɣɤtɯɣ-ci ɕti tɕe,
trs: He pushed the door, but the door was locked.' (tWJo 2012, 22)

src: stuxsi ɣɯ ɯ-χcɤl ri xtɯrkɯ a-βraʁ,
trs: The hide rope (connecting the yoke to the plough) is attached in the middle of the double yoke.'  (24-mbGo, 107)

src: tɤ-mu nɯ ɣɯ ɯ-tɕɯ nɯ kɯm-qʰu pjɤ-k-ɤ-βraʁ-ci tɕe,
trs: The old woman's son was attached on the back of the door.' (tWJo 2012, 63)

src: kɯm sɤcɯ mɤ-a-lɤt
trs: The door is not locked/has not been locked.' (140428 xiaohongmao-zh, 77)

src: ɯ-rkɯ nɯtɕu si ɯ-sno ci a-ta tɕe,
trs: Next to (the horse), there is a wooden saddle.' (2012 qachGa, 51)

src: nɯtɕu pɯ-a-ta ri maŋe
trs: (The meat) used to be there, but now it is not there (any more).' (meimeidegushi, 74)

src: sɤtɕʰa ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu rŋɯl tɯ-taɴɢoʁ ɲɯ-ɤ-rku tɕe,
trs: Inside the ground, there is a basketful of silver.' (2003 tamukatsa, 67)

src: ɯ-pa, tɕʰɯŋkʰɤr ɣɯ ɯ-spjɯŋ tu-kɯ-ɣi nɯnɯre ri li ɕom a-tsʰoʁ tɕe
trs: On the (top extremity of) the axle of the mill coming up from below, a piece of iron is attached.' (06-BGa, 66-67)

src: xɕiri ɣɯ ɯ-mtɕʰi ra [tɤ-se kɯ] pjɤ-k-ɤ-mar-ci ʑo
trs: The weasel's mouth was smeared with blood.' (140518 xuezhe he huangshulang-zh, 24)

src: ɯ-mtɕʰi ɯ-taʁ tɕe tɤ-se ra pjɤ-k-ɤ-mar-ci ʑo.
trs: Its mouth was smeared with blood.' (140518 xuezhe he huangshulang-zh, 19)

src: iʑɤra ji-kʰa nɯ [jɤɣɤt tɯ-tɤkʰrɤz nɯ] ku-o-fskɤr.
trs: Our house is surrounded by one row of balcony.' (2011-11-kha2, 4)

src: a-kʰa ɯ-rkɯ nɯnɯ [tɯ-ji] a-fskɤr.
trs: (The sides of) my house are surrounded by fields.' (elicited)

src: tɤ-pɤtso ra tɤ-lu a-jtsʰi
trs: The children have been given milk to drink.' (elicited)

src: iʑora ɕɤxɕo ku-oβdoʁβdi-j
trs: These days we are in good health.' (elicited)

src: tɯ-ci tʰamtɕɤt tɤ-se sɯ-ɤpa-j
trs: Let us turn all the water into blood.' (2003smanmi, 91)

src: kɯki ji-βdaʁmu kɯ ki kɯ-fse, nɤki, sɯŋgɯ pɣa nɯ́-wɣ-sɯ-ɤβzu-j
trs: Our queen has transformed us into bird from the forest.' (140520 ye

src: ɯ-mu [ɯ-ɕɣa kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi] [kɯ-mpɕɯ\redp{}mpɕɤr] ʑo na-sɯ-ɤβzu ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: He made his mother become young and beautiful.' (Norbzang 2005, 253)

src: xɕiri kɯ-fse nɯra kɯrŋi mɯ-ɲɯ-ɤ-rtsi lo.
trs: Weasel and the like do not count as beasts of prey (I think).

src: aʑo a-pi ɯ-ɕki kɯmtɕʰɯ ci nɯ-sɤ-mbi-a
trs: I asked my elder brother/sister to give me a toy.' (elicited)

src: tɕe a-ʁi nɯre ri, nɯ-sɤ-mbi-nɯ
trs: They asked for my younger brother (to come to marry their daughter) there.' (14-siblings, 210)

src: a-wɯ, tɯ-mgo kɤ-sɤ-mbi, tɯ-ci kɤ-sɤ-jtshi ɯβrɤ-tu
trs: Grandfather, would there be food or water that (we could) ask for (you to give us)?' (2011-05-nyima, 81)

src: ndʑi-ku pjɤ-nɯ-sɤɕɤt-ndʑi  to-rɤmpɕoʁ\redp{}mpɕɤr-ndʑi,
trs: They combed their hair and made themselves beautiful.' (correction of the previous example)

src: ɯ-jmŋo ɯ-ŋgɯ sɯŋgi ko-ntɕʰɤr
trs: He dreamt of a tiger / A tiger appeared to him in a dream.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-jmŋo ɯ-ŋgɯ ko-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ntɕʰɤr
trs: He made himself appear to her in a dream.' (2012 Norbzang, 116)

src: ɯ-lɤcu nɯtɕu jo-ɕe tɕe lo-ʑɣɤ-maŋlo.
trs: (The wolf) went to a place upstream (from the lamb), he placed himself upstream.' (2014 lang he yang, 8-9)

src: ma-pɯ-tɯ-ʑɣɤ-sɤ-ɕke
trs: Don't burn yourself!' (elicited)

src: ɯ-tʰoʁ zɯ pɯ-ʑɣɤɕpʰaβ-a
trs: I laid flat on the ground.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-tʰoʁ ɕpʰɤβɕpʰɤβ ʑo ɲɯ-rɤʑi, kɤ-nɯqambɯmbjom mɯ́j-cʰa
trs: The bird is staying on the ground without moving, it cannot fly.' (elicited)

src: tɤ-pɤtso nɯ ki kɯ-fse lu-xtʰom-nɯ ku-ɕɯ-rŋgɯ-nɯ pɯ-maʁ,
trs: People would not lie the babies down horizontally like this.' (140426 tApAtso kAnWBdaR1, 57)

src: rdɤstaʁ nɯ ɯ-tɯ-rʑi kɯ ɯ-tʰoʁ pjɤ́-wɣ-tʂaβ tɕe pjɤ́-wɣ-sat.
trs: The stones (in the wolf's belly) were so heavy that they caused him to fall down and die.' (140428 xiaohongmao-zh, 171)

src: tɕendɤre ɯ-ʁi nɯ kɤ-ŋke mɯ-ɲɤ-cʰa tɕe tɕendɤre lo-ndom ɕti tɕe
trs: His younger brother was not able to walk anymore, and lay down.' (2011-05-nyima, 58-59)

src: ɯ-ku lo lo-ru tɕe pjɤ-ndʐaβ, tɕe kɤ-nɯ-rɤru mɤ-kɯ-cʰa nɯ, tɕe lo-ndom tu-kɯ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: He fell down, head looking upstream, not able to get up by himself, so one says \forme{lo-ndom}.' (elicited, explanation of example \ref{ex:londom})

src: tʂu nɯtɕu ɲɤ-ʑɣɤ-xtʰom tɕe pɯ-kɯ-si to-ʑɣɤpa.
trs: He laid down on the road horizontally and pretended to be dead.' (140517 huli he lang-zh, 12)

src: tɯ-ci kɯ-wxtɯ\redp{}wxti nɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu ko-mtsaʁ. tɕe nɯtɕu ko-ʑɣɤ-tʂaβ qʰe
trs: He jumped into the river, he let himself roll into it.' (150830 baihe jiemei-zh, 209-2012)

src: ɯʑo nɯstʰɯci pjɯ-sɯzdɯɣ-a mɯ́j-pe ɲɤ-sɯso tɕe ko-ʑɣɤɕtʰɯz.
trs: She thought: ``It is not good of me to cause him so much worries'', and she revealed her true identity to him.' (2003kAndzwsqhaj2, 125)

src: tɤ-ʑɣɤ-ɕɯ-fka
trs: Eat to your full!' (a common polite expression)

src: nɤʑo nɯ, tɤ-muj stʰɯci a-tɤ-tɯ-ʑɣɤ-ɣɤ-ʑo,  nɤ-mbro nɯnɯ qale stʰɯci a-tɤ-ʑɣɤ-ɣɤ-mbjom tɕe,
trs: (If) you make yourself as light as a feather, and your horse makes itself as quick as the wind, (you will succeed).'  (2011-04-smanmi, 65-66)

src: to-ʑɣɤ-ɕɯ-mbɣom ʑo jo-nɯ-ɕe tɕe ɯ-jilco ra nɯ-ɕki to-ti.
trs: He hastened to go back (to the village), and told it to the other villagers.' (150902 hailibu-zh, 109)

src: porɤt nɯ kɯnɤ tɕetu kʰɤrka nɯtɕu tɕe pjɯ-ʑɣɤ-ɕɯ-ɴqoʁ ŋgrɤl.
trs: The small spider also lets itself hang down from the ceiling.' (26-mYaRmtsaR, 103)

src: ɯʑo daltsɯtsa ʑo li, masɤrɯrju ʑo, srɯtpʰu nɯ ɯ-ɕki ko-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ɤrmbat.
trs: He moved closer to the ogre slowly in secret.'  (160706 poucet6, 91)

src: ɯ-tɯ-ɤrqʰi pjɤ-saχaʁ ʑo ri, nɯ kɯnɤ jo-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ɤzɣɯt.
trs: (China)$_i$ was very far, but even so he managed to reach it$_i$.' (140511 alading-zh, 22)

src: smɤnba a-tɤ-tɯ-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-rtoʁ
trs: You should have yourself examined by a doctor.' (elicited)

src: tɕendɤre nɯ tu-kɤ-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-pjɤl kowa ntsɯ tu-βzu-ndʑi pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: (The mouse and the sparrow) took every measure to avoid (the cat).' (lWlu, 20)

src: tɯrme ɯʑo nɯnɯ rcanɯ [tɤ-muj ʑo kɯ-fse kɯ-ʑo] ɲɤ-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ɤpa,
trs: The man, him, made himself as light as a feather.' (04-smanmi, 84)

src: tɕetʰa tɯ-ji ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯnɯra, iɕqʰa tɯ-rdoʁ kɯ-fse nɯra ɕɯ-ndze, tɕendɤre, ɯʑo ku-nɯ-ʑɣɤ-fstɯn cʰa
trs: (This hen) will go and eat the grains in the fields, it will be able to take care of itself on its own.' (150822 laoye zuoshi zongshi duide-zh, 149)

src: ndʑi-pɤri kɯ-pɯ\redp{}pe to-βzu-ndʑi qʰe, ʑɤni to-nɯ-ʑɣɤ-ɕɯ-fka-ndʑi.
trs: They made a nice diner for themselves, and ate to their fill.' (160701 poucet2, 16-17)

src: kɯm cʰɤ-nɯ-ʑɣɤ-sɯ-ɤtsa
trs: The dock locked itself.' (elicited; describes house doors with an automatic locking system)

src: nɯ pa-mto nɯra mɯ-ɲɤ-ʑɣɤ-nɤ-stu.
trs: He did not believe the things that he himself had (just) seen.' (150830 baihe jiemei-zh, 106)

src: kʰa jo-nɯ-ɕe tɕendɤre [ɯ-ɣi ra cʰo] ko-k-ɤ-rqɯ\redp{}rqoʁ-nɯ-ci ʑo ɲɤ-ɣɤwu-nɯ.
trs: He went home and he and his relatives hug each other and cried.' (140512 fushang he yaomo1, 35)

src: tɕe nɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ srɯsmɤn ra pjɯ-lɤt-nɯ, tɕe nɯra pjɯ-nɯ-lɤt-nɯ tɕe nɯra ɲɯ-ɤmbɯ\redp{}mbi-nɯ ra ŋu
trs: They put medicine (against sinus inflammation) into the (snuff tobacco)$_i$, and they give it$_i$ to each other.' (30-CnAto, 17-18)

src: qartsɯ tɤ-mda qʰe tɕe cʰɯ-ɤ-wɯ\redp{}wum-nɯ qʰe kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn ʑo tɯtɯrca ku-rɤʑi-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: When winter arrives, they gather and stay together in great numbers.' (23-qapGAmtWmtW, 107-108)

src: tɯrsa ɯ-rkɯ χpɯn-ŋga tʰamtɕɤt a-ɕ-tɤ-tɯ-wum tɕe
trs: Go and collect all the monk robes near the cemetery.' (2003qachGa, 155)

src: tɕe tɕe ɯ-qa nɯ ɲɯ-ɤ-ndɯ\redp{}ndo, ɯ-taʁ nɯ ki kɯ-fse kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe,
trs: The base (of the mushroom \ch{刷把菌}{shuābǎjūn}{Ramaria formosa}) is all clustered together, but it has many top parts.' (23-tshAYCAnW, 12)

src: a-pi ɯ-ku nɯ-βzu-t-a
trs: I braided my sister's hair.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-pi cʰo ndʑi-ku ɲɯ-ɤ-βzɯ\redp{}βzu-ndʑi ndɤre,
trs: She and her sister braided each other's hair.' (2005 Kunbzang, 260)

src: kɯɕɯŋgɯ tɕe, tɤru ra tu-o-nɯsnɯɲɯ\redp{}ɲaʁ-nɯ tɕe cʰɯ-ɤ-ɣɤ-rlɯ\redp{}rlaʁ-nɯ pjɤ-ŋgrɤl
trs: In former times, chieftains used to harm (murder) each other and destroy each other's families.' (elicited)

imtwordshtml: ifr-peg-recip-caus-be.black-du-peg
src: ɲɤ-k-ɤ-sɯ-ɴqʰɯ\redp{}ɴqʰi-ndʑi tɕe, ɲɤ-k-ɤ-sɯɣ-ɲɯ\redp{}ɣɲaʁ-ndʑi-ci ʑo
trs: They$_{DU}$ made each other dirty, they blackened each other.' (elicited, can be said of children playing in a dirty place)

imtwordshtml: ifr.ipfv-peg-recip-rob-pl-peg
src: nɯnɯ jɤ-kɤ-ɣɤrɤt nɯ pjɤ-k-ɤ-nɯsɯkʰɯ\redp{}kʰo-nɯ-ci.
trs: The beasts fought with each other to get the (piece of cloth) that he had thrown (at them).' (150825 huluwa-zh, 150)

src: ɲɤ-k-ɤ-nɤntsʰɯ\redp{}ntsʰi-ndʑi-ci, ɲɤ-k-ɤ-nɤ-pɯ\redp{}pe-ndʑi tɕe
trs: They fell in love with each other.' (150827 mengjiangnv-zh, 104-105)

src: srɯnmɯ ra cʰɤ-sɯ-ɤ-wɯ\redp{}wum tɕe,
trs: She gathered the râkhasîs together.' (2011-05-nyima, 33)

src: ɲɯ-sɯ-ɤ-tɯ\redp{}te-a ri tɕe mɤʑɯ ku-o-ndɯ\redp{}ndo-ndʑi ɕti
trs: I am (repeatedly) separating them (two fighting ants), but they grab each other again (each time).' (conversation 14-05-01)

src: ʁdɯxpa kɤrpu ɣɯ ɯ-tɕɯ cʰo aʑo a-tɕɯ nɯ tɤ-alɯlɤt-ndʑi tɕe, tɕe a-tɕɯ ɣɯ-sat pjɤ-ŋu ri,
trs: Gdugpa dkarpo's son and my son fought with each other, and my son was about to be killed.' (28-smAnmi, 253)

src: nɯnɯ ɕɤmɯɣdɯ tu-lɤt-nɯ tɕe pjɯ-sat-nɯ ɕti.
trs: They shoot at it with guns and kill it.' (28-qapar, 20)

src: qacʰɣa ɯ-taʁ ʑo li tɯdi nɯ ci to-lɤt.
trs: He too shot an arrow at the fox.' (140507 jinniao-zh, 82)

src: nɯnɯ cʰo ci kɤ-anɯrŋɤrɯru-ndʑi tɕe
trs: They exchanged a look with each other'. (2010-07, pear story)

imtwordshtml: tral-ipfv-genr:S/O-caus-pass-caus-drink
src: `nɯtɕu tɯ-ci z-ɲɯ-kɯ-sɯ-ɤ-j-tsʰi ɲɯ-ntsʰi' to-k-ɤmɯ-ti-ndʑi
trs: They said to each other `we should go there and ask for water to drink.'' (Nyima wodzer 2002, 59)

src: nɯnɯ kɤndʑi-sqʰaj ɯ-rɟit nɯ tɕe ``a-mɤtsa" tu-kɯ-ɤmɯ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: Children of sisters call each other `my maternal parallel cousin'.' (140425 kWmdza4, 5)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ li bɤβbɤβ ʑo kɯ-pa tɕe, kɯ-ɤmɯ-stʰɯ\redp{}stʰaβ ʑo kɯ-dɤn tu-ɬoʁ ŋu.
trs: (These mushrooms) grow in clumps, one against the other in great numbers.' (23-mbrAZim, 9)

src: ma nɯnɯ ɯʑo ʁɟa [tɯ-mdʑu ɯ-taʁ] kú-wɣ-stʰaβ tɕe mɤrtsaβ,
trs: If one puts it (this plant) on one's tongue (without anything else), it is spicy.' (13-tCamu, 13)

src: <liangshanbo> cʰondɤre pjɯ-ɤmɯ-mto-ndʑi mɯ-pjɤ-jɤɣ tɕe
trs: She and Liang Shanbo were not allowed to see each other.' (150826 liangshanbo zhuyingtai-zh, 164)

src: kupa-skɤt tú-wɣ-βzu tɕe nɯnɯ a-pɯ-ŋu, iʑo ɣɯ <guoyu> ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe, nɯnɯ kɤsɯfse ɣɯ ji-rju ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe, pjɯ-kɯ-ɤmɯ-tso ɲɯ-ra ri, li nɯ koŋla mɯ́j-tso-nɯ.
trs: When we speak Chinese, since it is our national language, everybody's language, we should be able to understand each other, but (the people from Tshobdun) do not understand it completely either.' (150901 tshuBdWnskAt, 15-17)

src: nɯre ri tɕe kɤ-amɯfse-tɕi tɕe, tɕendɤre wuma ʑo pɯ-amɯmi-tɕi
trs: We got to know each other there, and we were in very good terms.' (12-BzaNsa, 6)

src: jo-sɯ-ɣe tɕe iɕqʰa <gengqubing> nɯ cʰo pjɤ-sɯ-ɤmɯ-mto.
trs: The (old man) brought them in and had them meet Geng Qubing.' (150906 qingfeng-zh, 58)

src: tɕiʑo andʑɯ-βri-tɕi ra
trs: The two of us have to look out for each other.' (elicited)

src: tɕeri tɤ-rɟit nɯ ɲɯ-ɤmɟɤkʰo-ndʑi qʰe koŋla tu-o-nɯ-rɯɕmɯ\redp{}ɕmi-ndʑi kɯnɤ mɯ́j-tsu ma tɕe li tú-wɣ-nɯ-tsɯm ɲɯ-ɕti.
trs: She$_i$ hands the child$_j$ to him$_k$ and he$_k$ takes him$_j$, but they$_{i+k}$ don't get the time to exchange any words and she$_i$ is taken back to heaven.' (150828 donglang, 174-175)

src: pjɤ-k-ɤ-prɤt-ci
trs: It has been broken (by someone).

src: wo a-ʑi ra nɯ-mkɤɣɯr pɯ-mbrɤt
trs: My lady, your necklace broke!' (2003 Kunbzang, 255)

src: ndʑi-ʑmbrɯ cʰɤ-mbɣaʁ.
trs: (One day, there was a terrible storm  on the ocean, and) their boat capsized.' (140511 xinbada-zh, 18)

src: popo pjɤ-nɯ-ɕlɯɣ tɕe, pjɤ-ɴɢrɯ.
trs: She dropped the earthenware and it broke.' (2003gesar, 329)

src: pjɯ-tɯ-qlɯt qʰe pjɯ-ɴɢlɯt ɲɯ-ɕti.
trs: (Twigs of willow that grow in lower altitude) break as soon as one breaks it.' (07-Zmbri, 6)

src: fsaŋ ɕ-pjɯ-ta-nɯ ŋu. tɕe loŋrta ra ɕ-tu-tsʰoʁ-nɯ
trs: (In the morning of the first day of the year) People go (there) and make fumigation, plant prayer flags...' (140522 Kamnyu zgo, 308-309)

src: tɕe tɯ-kʰɤl nɯtɕu, χsɯ-cɤβ, kɯβde-cɤβ jamar ku-tsʰoʁ
trs: In each place (in each section on the stalk of the plant), three or four pods grow.' (09-stoR, 42)

src: tɯ-kʰɤl ri, ʁnɯ-cɤβ, χsɯ-cɤβ jamar ku-ndzoʁ cʰa
trs: In each place (section on its stalk), two or three pods can grow.' (09-stoR, 35)

src: stɤβtsʰɤt mɯ-pɯ-tɯ-nɯ-cʰa-ndʑi ɕti tɕe, ndʑi-ʁo a-mɤ-nɯ-mbi
trs: (It is not that I don't want to give her to you), it is that you failed in the contest, don't feel frustrated.' (2003sras, 118)

src: tɤjpa kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi ka-lɤt ri, mɯ́j-ʁdɯɣ, pɤjkʰu tu-ndʐi ɲɯ-cʰa.
trs: There was a bit of snow, but it is not serious, it can still melt.' (conversation 15-12-17)

src: pɯ-ndʐaβ qʰe, paχɕi ra pa-nɯ-lwoʁ tɕe,
trs: He fell down and spilled the apples.' (2010 Tshendzin pear story, 9)

src: kʰri ɯ-taʁ nɯtɕu ko-mbɣaʁ nɤ ɲɤ-mbɣaʁ tɕe
trs: She tossed over her bed.' (140430 yufu he tade qizi-zh, 237)

src: ɯ-χti ci na-nɯ-ɕar ri, tɕendɤre kɯ-maqʰu qʰe pɯ-nɯɴɢɤt-ndʑi
trs: She found a husband, but they eventually divorced.' (14-siblings, 99-100)

src: nɤʑo jɤ-ɕe, tɕiʑo nɯɴɢɤt-tɕi ma mɤ-jɤɣ
trs: Go away, we absolutely have to part ways.' (2002qajdoskAt, 75)

imt: this.year \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-flower \textsc{aor}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-release \textsc{dem} \textsc{aor}:\textsc{down}-\textsc{auto}-\textsc{acaus}:cause.to.fall also next.year \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-place \textsc{dem} again \textsc{dem} about what \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-exist \textsc{dem} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-fruit \textsc{ipfv}-make[III] be.\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact}
src: ɣɯjpa ɯ-mɯntoʁ nɯ-kɤ-lɤt nɯ pɯ-nnɯ-ŋgra kɯnɤ fsaqʰe qʰe nɯ ɯ-sta nɯ li nɯ jamar tɕʰi kɯ-tu nɯ ɯ-mat ɲɯ-βze ɕti
trs: Even if the flowers that have blossomed this year and fall down, the next year it makes at that place as many fruits (as there were flowers the previous year).' (11-qarGW, 62)

src: nɯ-rom kɯnɤ mɤ-ɣɤ-ɴɢlɯt
trs: Even after it has dried up, (the wood of high mountain willow twig) does not break easily.' (07-Zmbri, 59)

src: zrɯɣ nɯ-nɤmbɣaʁlaʁ rdɯl mɤ-tɕɤt
trs: When a louse rolls around, it does not raise dust.' (proverb)

src: nɯnɯ rgoŋlu nɯ nɯɕimɯma ʑo tɯ-nɤndʐaβlaβ jo-ʑa tɕe jo-ndʐaβ nɤ jo-ndʐaβ.
trs: The ball immediately started rolling over and over.' (140514 huishuohua de niao-zh, 136)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ pjɯ́-wɣ-ta tɕe, tɕe snama tɤ-ŋke tɕe tɕe, mɤ-nɤŋgiolo.
trs: One puts (belly and neck bands on the burdens), so that when the beast of burden walks, (the burden) does not move around (on its back).' (30-tAsno, 98)

src: tɤ-pɤtso tɤjpɣom ɯ-taʁ ɲɯ-nɯŋgiolɯlo
trs: The child slides on the ice.' (elicited)

imtwordshtml: ifr-caus-acaus:melt-pst:tr-1sg
src: ta-mar cʰɤ-sɯɣ-ndʐi-t-a
trs: I let the butter melt (by forgetting it next to a source of heat).' (elicited)

src: kʰru nɯ cʰɯ-ftʂi-nɯ tɕe, tɕe nɯnɯ pjɯ-lɤt-nɯ ɲɯ-ɕti tɕe,
trs: They melt the pig iron and pour it into (the mold).' (25-qraR, 33)

src: rasti cʰo rɤjndoʁ ni, pjɯ́-wɣ-ʁndzɤr-ndʑi tɕe ɲɯ́-wɣ-z-nɯɴɢɤt-ndʑi ŋu.
trs: One separates the turnip from its root by cutting them.' (150903 kAJar, 7-8)

src: aʑɯɣ  a-me ci tu tɕe, nɯnɯ kɯ tɯ-sŋaʁ pa-βzjoz tɕe,
trs: I have a daughter, and she has learned sorcery.' (140512 fushang he yaomo-zh, 143)

src: ɯ-me nɯ pɯ-rɤ-βzjoz ri tʰam ɯ-<gongzuo> ɯ-ma me
trs: Her daughter went to school (studied things) but has no job now.' (17-lhazgron, 60)

src: sqɯ-mpɕar kɤ-ŋa-t-a
trs: I bought (it) on credit and owe (him) ten renminbi.' (elicited)

src: tɕe nɯnɯ ɯ-rme tu ma mɤ-sɤ-ndza ma ɯ-mdzu me.
trs: It has hair, but does not prick, because it has no thorns.' (15-babW, 97)

src: mdzadi nɯ wuma ʑo sɤ-ndza. wuma ʑo kɯ-ndza tɕe rɤʑa.
trs: Fleas bite a lot. They bite people a lot, and it itches.' (21-mdzadi, 16-17)

src: nɯ-ji ra kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn kɯ-jɯ\redp{}jom lo-pɣaʁ-nɯ
trs: They had ploughed many wide fields for them.' (2002 qajdoskAt, 90)

src: zgoku tu-ɕe qʰe lu-rɤ-pɣaʁ nɤ, tɤ-rɤku cʰo ra pjɯ-ji qʰe,  tɕe nɯ kɯ-fse ku-rɤʑi pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: (The old man) lived by going to the mountain, clearing fields and  planting crops.' (150831 jubaopen-zh, 3-5)

src: ɯʑɤɣ ɯ-βra kɯ-rkɯ\redp{}rkɯn ntsɯ ma mɯ-pjɤ-nɯ-ta. ɯ-ro ra lonba ɲɯ-rɤ-mbi pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: He would only keep a little for himself, and give away the rest.' (150902 hailibu-zh, 8)

src: kɯmŋu ma mɯ-nɯ-ʁaʁ ɯ-qʰu tɕe, tɕe χsɯm nɯ nɯ-rɤ-mbi-tɕi tɕe
trs: Only five (of the twelve eggs) hatches, and we gave three (of the chicks) (to other people).' (22-kumpGa, 81-82)

src: a-kumpɣa ɯ-pɯ kɯ-sɤjndɯ\redp{}jndɤt ʑo pɯ-ŋu ri, tɕeri <xingqitian> <fangjia> tɕe tu-nɯ-ɕe-a pɯ-ra tɕe ɕ-kɤ-rɤ-ɕtʂɯ-a.
trs: My chicks were very cute, but on sunday, I had to go back on holiday, and I went (to someone$_i$) and entrusted him/her/them$_i$ with them. (150819 kumpGa, 48-49)

src: a-mu a-wa ni a-kʰɯna ɲɤ-rɤ-mbi-ndʑi
trs: My parents gave my dog away.' (elicitation, 2019-11-30)

src: a-wa kɯ aʑo nɯ́-wɣ-rɤ-mbi-a
trs: My father gave me away.' (elicited)

src: tɤfsɤri kɤ-βzu ci pjɯ-ta-sɯxɕɤt.
trs: Let me teach you how to make threads.' (vid-20140506043657, 43)

src: li sloχpɯn ta-ndo-t-a tɕe, nɯre pjɯ-sɤ-sɯxɕat-a pɯ-ŋu.
trs: I too became a teacher, and I was teaching there.' (12-BzaNsa, 19)

src: a-ɕki ɣɯ-nɯ-rɤtʰutʰe
trs: He came and asked me (for information).' (elicited)

src: tɕe ɯ-me nɯnɯ <xianzhong> nɯtɕu pjɯ-rɤ-βzjoz pɯ-ŋu ri,
trs: (At the time when) her daughter was going to school, (her father was drinking alcohol and neglected his parental duties).' (17-lhazgron, 67)

src: <caichen> nɯnɯ pjɤ-rɤ-βzjoz ntsɯ. jɯɣi ntsɯ pjɤ-k-ɤsɯ-ndɯn-ci.
trs: Caichen was always studying, always reading books.' (150907 niexiaoqian-zh, 21)

src: tɤ-rʑaβ nɯ pjɤ-rɤ-ɕpʰɤt,
trs: The wife was patching clothes.' (qajdoskAt 2002, 20)

src: χsɯ-sla pɯ-βzjoz-a
trs: I have learned it (how to make ploughshares) for three months.' (2010-09, 14)

src: nɯra nɯ-pʰe nɯtɕu, χsɯ-xpa nɯ pɯ-rɤ-βzjoz-a.
trs: I have studied with them for three years.' (160721 XpWN, 30)

src: ɯʑɤɣ nɯ kɤ-nɯ-tʰu na-nɯ-jmɯt ɲɯ-ŋu, tɕeri nɯ ma tu-rɤ-tʰu mɯ-nɯ-jɤɣ ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: He had forgotten to ask his own (question), but he was not allowed to ask questions anymore.' (divination, 2005, 48-9)

src: tɤ-tɕɯ nɯ kɯ-si to-rɤŋgat.
trs: The man (had fallen ill) and was about to die.' (rkongrgyal2.2002, 24)

src: βlama ɲɤ-ɕar-nɯ tɕe, ko-rɤ-tʰu-nɯ ri
trs: They looked a lama and consulted him/ask for his advice.' (rkongrgyal2.2002, 25)

src: tɕe kɯ-sɤ-ndza tu-oɣɯɣu ri,
trs: (The râkshasî demoness revealed her true nature) and was about to eat someone (one of them), but ...' (28-smAnmi, 397)

src: rɯdaʁ nɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ kɯ-sɤ-ndza nɯ, kɯrŋi tu-kɯ-ti ŋu
trs: Among the animals, the carnivorous ones are called `beasts'.' (elicited, explanation of example \ref{ex:kWsAndza.GW}, §\ref{sec:subject.participle.subject.relative})

src: aʑo kɯ-sɤ-tʰu ɕe-a
trs: I am going to ask for (the girls) in marriage.' (2003 Kunbzang, 5)

src: tɯ-mɯ wuma ʑo tɤ-me tɕe, tɕendɤre tsʰitsuku ɕ-ku-sɤ-nɯrtɕa-nɯ tɕe, fsaŋ ra ɕ-pjɯ-ta-nɯ, ɕ-pjɯ-rɟaʁ-nɯ nɯra tɕe, tɕe tɯ-mɯ ku-sɯ-lɤt-nɯ pjɤ-ŋgrɤl. tɕe nɯ ɯ-sɤz-nɤma ɣɯ sɤtɕʰa nɯ znɤrɣɤma tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: When there was no rain at all, people would go there and do teasing, make fumigations and dance, and cause rain to come. They call the place where these activities were performed \forme{znɤrɣɤma}.' (140522 Kamnyu zgo, 246-252)

src: ʑɯβdaʁ ɕ-kú-wɣ-nɯrtɕa
trs: One teases the mountain  gods.' (gloss of example \ref{ex:znArGAma}).

src: ɯʑo kɯ tsʰitsuku ɲɤ-ndɯn tɕe kʰɤndɯn ra ɲɤ-βzu
trs: He recited something, he recited a formula.' (140510 sanpian yumao-zh, 100)

src: mtsʰalɤɲaʁ cʰo mtsʰalɤɣrum nɯ ʁnaʁna kɯ kɯ-mtsɯɣ
trs: Both black and white nettle sting.' (11-mtshalu, 26)

src: tɕʰeme [tɤ-ɕpʰɤt ɯ-kɯ-ta] kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi pjɤ-tu ma nɯ ma kɯ-rɤ-tʂɯβ pjɤ-me.
trs: There were a few women who made patches, but no (women) tailors.' (12-kAtsxWb, 12)

src: nɯ-ʁjoʁ ra kɯ tɯ-ndza tu-βzu-nɯ nɯra, ɲɯ-sɤ-nɤkʰu-nɯ ra pjɤ-ɕti qʰe,
trs: Their servants were making food, they were inviting people.' (28-qAjdoskAt, 136-137)

src: nɤ-tɯ-sɤ-nɤkʰe nɯ mɤ-ra
trs: You should not bully people like that (your bullying of other people should not cross the line).' (28-qAjdoskAt, 14)

src: iɕqʰa tɕaχpa nɯra kɯ li, laχtɕʰa z-ɲɤ-sɤ-nɯsɯkʰo-nɯ
trs: The robbers had gone and robbed some people from their things.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 113)

src: Dai.Song ɣɯ, nɤkinɯ, ɯ-ɕaχpu nɯ kɯ ɲɤ́-wɣ-sqɤr tɕe, nɤkinɯ, pjɤ́-wɣ-z-rɤ-rɤt ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: One of Dai Song's friend's asked him to draw something.' (2010-kewen-07, 10)

src: tɕe nɯ tɤ-ri ɲɯ́-wɣ-nɯ-βzu tɕe cʰɯ́-wɣ-z-rɤ-tʂɯβ ŋu
trs: One (can) then make the thread and use it to sew things.' (13-tAsAsqAri, 40)

imtwordshtml: aor-caus-recip-understand-pst:tr-1sg-du
src: a-pi cʰo a-ʁi ni kɤ-sɯ-ɤmɯ-tso-t-a-ndʑi
trs: I helped my elder and younger brothers/sisters understanding each other.' (elicited)

src: fsosoz ndɤre, tɤ-amɯ-rmbɯ ʑo.
trs: The next morning, (the bowl) was completely filled (with food).' (2003kandZislama, 145)

src: tɕe tamar kɯnɤ, nɤki tɕʰorzi nɯ ɯ-mŋu me,  ɯ-qa me nɯra ɲɯ-sɯ-ɤmɯ-zɣɯt ʑo ɲɯ-mar ɲɯ-ra
trs: (The jar maker) also to apply butter evenly to the opening and the  bottom of the alcohol jar.' (30-kWrAfcAr, 65-66)

src: nɯ rgɤtpu nɯ pjɤ-mu tɕe,
trs: The old man was afraid.' (140426 xiaohaizi he hua de shizi-zh, 10)

src: sɯŋgi nɯnɯ pjɤ-sɤɣ-mu tɕe pjɤ-nɯɣ-mu ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: The lion$_i$ was terrifying and (the old man) was afraid of it$_i$.' (shizi yu nongfu-zh, 7)

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-tɕɯ nɯ fso tʰɯ-wxti tɕe tha aʑɯɣ mɤ-sɤ-scit
trs: When his son has grown up, it will not be a pleasant situation for me.' (28-smAnmi, 18)

src: tɯ-xpa tɕe, wuma pjɤ-sɤ-mtsɯr
trs: One year, there was a famine.' (elicited)

src: [kɤ-ndza] mɯ-pɯ-kɯ-nɤz ma sɤndɤɣ tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: We/people would not dare to eat it, because they say that it is poisonous.' (19-khWlu, 87)

src: tɕe [kɤ-nɤjaʁ] mɤ-sɤ-nɤz ʑo ma tɯ-jaʁ ku-otsa ɕti tɕe mŋɤm.
trs: It is such that people do not dare to touch it, as it pricks in one's hand and it hurts.' (15-babW, 58)

src: nɯfse kɯ-nɤ-ŋkɯ\redp{}ŋke ɕe-a ma tɕe kʰa kɤ-rɤʑi ntsɯ ɲɯ-kɯ-dɯɣ
trs: I go to walk (without a special reason), because I don't feel well staying at home all the time.' (conversation, 2013-12-24)

src: kutɕu aʑo-sti ɲɯ-ɕti-a tɕe ɲɯ-sɤɣ-dɯɣ
trs: I am here alone, and I am fed up of that (the fact of being alone make one feel fed up).' (07-deluge, 42)

src: [nɯ kɯ-fse kɤ-rɤʑi] ɲɯ-dɯɣ-a.
trs: I am fed up of living like that.' (140426 jiagou he lang-zh, 36)

src: [kɤ-rɤʑi] wuma ʑo pjɤ-sɤɣ-dɯɣ.
trs: Living (there) was very difficult to endure.' (150827 taisui-zh, 13)

src: tɯ-sŋi [mɯntoʁ ʁnɯz χsɯm jamar lú-wɣ-taʁ] ɲɯ-sɤ-cʰa
trs: In one day, it is possible to weave two or three patterns (on the belt).' (2011-06-thaXtsa, 52)

src: tɕe sɯŋgɯ ku-rɤʑi ɕti tɤɣa kɤ-mto me. ri [tu-mbri] nɯ sɤ-mtsʰɤm.
trs: It stays in the forest and is never seen in the open, but it can be heard singing.' (23-scuz, 119-120)

src: tɯ-mɯ mɯ́j-lɤt tɕe tɤjmɤɣ mɯ́j-sɤ-rndu
trs: It is not raining, and so it is not easy to find mushrooms.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-rmi ɲɯ-sɤ-sɯz
trs: His name is well-known.' (elicited)

src: mɤʑɯ ɯ-rmi mɤ-kɯ-sɤ-spa xcat ɕti
trs: There are many other (plants) whose name is not known.' (08-tWrgi, 54)

src: a-jaʁ pɯ-ɕke
trs: My hand was burnt.' (elicited)

src: smi tʰa-βlɯ-nɯ ri, pjɤ-sɤ-ɕke qʰe, ʑakastaka jo-nɯ-rɤɕi-nɯ qʰe,
trs: They made a fire (and used their legs as tripods to make tea), but since it was burning, and each of them pulled (their legs and were not able to prepare food).' (2014-kWlAG, 333)

src: <diandian> ʑo kɯ-rɤʑi ɲɯ-mɯɕtaʁ, tu-kɯ-ŋke tɕe ɲɯ-sɤ-ɕke
trs: Staying in the shop it is cold, but walking (on the street) it is hot.' (conversation, 14-05-10)

src: ɯ-tʰoʁ ɲɯ-sɤ-ŋgio tɕe tɕoχtsi ɲɯ́-wɣ-kio ɲɯ-kʰɯ
trs: The ground is slippery, and one can move the table by making it glide on it.' (elicited)

src: si kɯ-wxtɯ\redp{}wxti ɲɯ-βze cʰa ma wuma ʑo ɲɯ-ɣɤ-wxti.
trs: It can grow into a hug tree, as it easily becomes huge.' (07-Zmbri, 10)

src: tɯrme mɤ-kɯ-ɲɟɯr, nɯnɯ mɤ-kɯ-ɣɤ-rgɤz tɕe tɕe nɯnɯ tɤtʰo tu-sɤrmi-nɯ ŋu.
trs: Persons who don't change, who don't age quickly, people call them `pines'.' (07-tAtho, 26)

src: nɯra iʑo ji-ji pɯ-kɤ-z-mɤku nɯ iʑo ɯ-pʰɯt ku-z-mɤku-j ma ɲɯ-ɣɤ-mda
trs: Our fields, that have been (sowed) first, we harvest they first, because the (crops) ripen earlier (than in other places, higher up in altitude).' (2010-09)

src: iɕqʰa sɤtɕʰa nɯ waɟɯ ɲɯ-ɣɤ-nmu.
trs: Earthquakes are frequent in this place.' (elicited)

src: nɤ-ʁo ɯ-tɯ-ɣɤ-mbi nɯ!
trs: You are so easily discouraged!' (elicited)

src: nɤ-tɤ-rʑaʁ ɯ-ɲɯ́-ɣɤ-ɕe
trs: Is the time passing quickly for you?' (elicited)

src: tɕe qaʑo kɯ-wxti nɯra ɣɯ qʰe, nɯ-rme ɲɯ-rɲɟi qʰe ɲɯ-nɯɣɯ-krɤɣ, kɯ-xtɕi nɯra ɣɯ, nɯ-rme ɲɯ-xtɯt qʰe, mɯ́j-nɯɣɯ-krɤɣ.
trs: The big sheep, their wool is long and thus easy to shear, the small ones, their wool is short and difficult to shear.' (160712 smAG, 28-29)

src: ci nɯ xɕaj ɯ-mdoʁ tsa ɯ-kɯ-ndo nɯ mɤ-nɯɣɯ-mto. tɕe wuma ʑo mɯ\redp{}mɤ-pɯ-kɯ-tso nɤ mɤ́-wɣ-mto
trs: The other one, which has the colour of grass, is not easy to see; unless you know it very well, you won't see it.' (07-Cku, 58)

src: nɯ mɯ́j-nɯɣɯ-ti
trs: This (meaning) is difficult to express (in Japhug).' (heard in context)

imtwordshtml: 3sg.poss-neg-nmlz:deg-facil-walk
src: tɕʰeme nɯnɯ tʰɤlwa ɲɯɣɲɯɣ zɯ to-ɕe qʰe, maka ɯ-mɤ-tɯ-nɯɣɯ-ŋke pjɤ-saχaʁ ʑo,
trs: The girl went up the (path made of) soft earth, and it was extremely difficult to walk on it.' (2014-kWlAG, 148)

src: tʂu ɯ-rkɯ ɲɯ-ɤrmbat tɕe, ɲɯ-nɯɣɯ-ɕe
trs: (This place) is close to the road, it is easy to go to.' (elicited)
